premises: If a contract is signed by both parties, it is legally binding
A contract is signed by both parties
incorrect conclusions: The contract is not legally binding
The contract being legally binding implies that a contract is signed by both parties
The contract not being legally binding implies that a contract is signed by both parties
The contract not being signed by both parties implies that the contract is not legally binding

premises: If evidence is presented in court, the case will proceed
incorrect conclusions: The case proceeding implies that evidence is presented in court
The case not proceeding implies that evidence is presented in court
Evidence not being presented in court implies that the case will not proceed

premises: If a law is passed, it must be enforced
incorrect conclusions: The law must not be enforced
The law being enforced implies that a law is passed
The law not being enforced implies that a law is passed
The law not being passed implies that the law must not be enforced
